page.title: 12Microplant Factory, Longnor
page.content: The microplant factory was founded in June 1983 by A.P.Ranchoad and Martin Stokes. It was not the first factory of its kind in the U.K. Cuttings are taken from adult plants and are put in an artificial mixture that feeds them. They are then kept in special storage containers heated to the exact temperature for four weeks. Then they are transplanted into compost and put in a greenhouse until they reach a certain height. They are then transplanted to nurseries all over the world. The greenhouse is held by a frame and the sides are filled up with air to insulate it. All the building is lit by electricity. If they have a power-cut they seal up the insulation tubes. The workers have to take off their white overalls before going outside in case of contamination.
